description: Radical Entertainment is a Canadian video game development studio founded in 1991 and based in Vancouver, British Columbia. The company became known for creating action-oriented games across multiple platforms, including The Simpsons: Hit & Run (2003), Prototype (2009), and Prototype 2 (2012).

Games developed by Radical Entertainment utilize RCF files to store their game assets. For example, RCF files packaged with The Simpsons: Hit & Run contain essential game data, such as audio dialogues, music, and other resources necessary for gameplay.

NOTE: Vivendi Universal acquired Radical Entertainment in 2005, and it then became a part of Activision Blizzard after the companies merged in 2008. After releasing Prototype 2 , Radical Entertainment was significantly downsized in 2012 and no longer produces original games.
